com.vaadin.addon.charts.model
Class DataSeriesItem

java.lang.Object
  com.vaadin.addon.charts.model.AbstractConfigurationObject
      com.vaadin.addon.charts.model.DataSeriesItem
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BoxPlotItem, DataSeriesItem3d, WaterFallSum
public class DataSeriesItem
extends AbstractConfigurationObject

The DataSeriesItem class represents a single entry in a DataSeries.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Summary
DataSeriesItem()
           
DataSeriesItem(Date date, Number y)
          Constructs a DataSeriesItem with the given date as X value and Y value.
DataSeriesItem(Date date, Number min, Number max)
          Constructs a DataSeriesItem with the given date as X value with min and max values for use in range visualizations.
DataSeriesItem(Number x, Number y)
          Constructs an item with X and Y values
DataSeriesItem(Number x, Number y, Color color)
          Constructs an item with numerical values for the X- and Y-axis and assigns the specified color to the item.
DataSeriesItem(Number x, Number min, Number max)
          Constructs a DataSeriesItem with the given X, min and max values for use in range visualizations.
DataSeriesItem(String categoryName, Number y)
          Constructs an item with a category name and a Y value
DataSeriesItem(String categoryName, Number y, Color color)
          Constructs an item with a category name and a value on the Y-axis and assigns the specified color to the item.

Method Detail

setX

public void setX(Date date)
Sets the given date as the x value.

Note, that internally the Date value is stored as an "epoch timestamp", adjusted by timezone offset. So when calling getX() you might get a bit odd result.

Parameters:
date -

getName

public String getName()
Returns:
The category name of the data item or null if not defined
